metadata.feature_description: Edit existing wiki articles with version tracking and approval workflow

steps.action: Navigate to existing wiki article in Test Activity Group
steps.expected: Article page loads with content visible
steps.actual: Article 'Group Wiki Test Article' loaded successfully with content displayed

steps.action: Click Edit button to open edit dialog
steps.expected: Edit dialog opens with current article content
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened showing title, content editor, tags, and other fields

steps.action: Switch to HTML mode and add new content with edit marker
steps.actual: HTML editor displayed and content was modified with '[EDIT TEST - Content updated on January 9, 2026 at 10:30 AM]'

steps.expected: Content changes are saved and visible on article page
steps.actual: Content changes saved successfully, edit marker visible on article page

steps.expected: Edit dialog opens with title field
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened with title field showing current title

steps.action: Change title to 'Group Wiki Test Article - Title Edited'
steps.actual: Title field updated with new text

steps.expected: Title changes saved, page URL and heading updated
steps.actual: Title saved successfully. Page URL changed to include '-Title-Edited', heading displays new title

steps.action: Open edit dialog and add new tag 'edited-tag'
steps.expected: New tag is added to tag list
steps.actual: New tag 'edited-tag' added successfully to tag list

steps.action: Toggle 'Display a Table of Contents' checkbox off
Click Publish to save metadata changes
steps.actual: Tags updated (now shows 'group-wiki, testing, edited-tag'), TOC changes saved

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save as draft vs publish (Approved checkbox)

steps.action: Open edit dialog and uncheck 'Approved' checkbox
steps.expected: Approved checkbox can be toggled off

steps.action: Click Publish to save with Approved unchecked
steps.expected: Article is saved (as superuser, approval workflow may differ)
steps.actual: Article saved and published. As SuperUser/moderator, content is published directly regardless of Approved checkbox

steps.action: Check revision history for version tracking
steps.actual: History dialog shows version tracking with multiple revisions, all in 'Published' state

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki module list page and click Edit on 'Welcome to the Wiki' primary article
steps.expected: Primary article edit dialog opens with simplified interface
steps.actual: Primary article edit dialog opened. Only Content field visible - no Title, Article Type, Tags, TOC, or Approved checkbox (as expected for primary article)

steps.action: Modify content in HTML mode with edit marker '[PRIMARY ARTICLE EDITED - January 9, 2026]'
steps.actual: Content modified successfully in HTML editor

steps.action: Click Publish to save primary article changes
steps.actual: Primary article content saved. Edit marker '[PRIMARY ARTICLE EDITED - January 9, 2026]' visible on Wiki landing page

steps.action: Open edit dialog and clear the title field completely

steps.actual: Validation message 'Text is required' displayed next to title field, publish blocked

observations: The Redactor WYSIWYG editor requires HTML mode for programmatic content modifications to persist correctly
Article Type dropdown is disabled for existing articles (cannot change article type after creation)
Primary article editing has a simplified interface - only Content field is shown, no Title/Tags/TOC/Approved fields
Primary article edit dialog includes a Delete button for moderators
As SuperUser/moderator, the Approved checkbox behavior allows direct publishing regardless of its state
Version tracking works correctly - each edit creates a new revision entry in History
Title changes also update the article URL slug automatically
